questions.question: An estimated (__________) million U.S. residents aged 12 and older abused prescription drugs at least once in their lifetime.  Is it 16, 26, or 36 million?
25% of high school seniors in the United States abused narcotics (other than heroin) at least once in their lifetime.
Glue, correction fluid, markers, and nail polish remover are used as inhalants.
questions.result: TRUE - In fact, more than 1,000 common products can be classified as inhalants.

questions.question: 38% of parents admitted they are not aware of the risks involving inhalant abuse.
Marijuana is not harmful because it is "all natural" and comes from a plant.
questions.result: FALSE - Marijuana smoke contains some of the same cancer-causing compounds as tobacco, sometimes in higher concentrations.

questions.question: 10% of 8th graders have admitted to being intoxicated at least once.
"Special K" can be (__________).
questions.result: SNORTED AND SWALLOWED - "Special K" is used as an anesthetic for animals and is popular at raves.

questions.question: Some methamphetamine users avoid sleep for 3 to (__________) days.
"Ice" is the street name for smokable methamphetamine.
